meanings.definition: The reflection of radiation or particles back in the direction from which they came.
meanings.sent1: The backscattering of sunlight off the mirror made it shine brightly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the backscattering of radio waves to understand the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The backscattering of confetti at the party created a magical effect.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the backscattering of joyous memories.
meanings.sent5: The backscattering of water droplets in the fountain was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The process of scattering light or sound waves in a backward direction.
meanings.sent1: The backscattering of sound waves in the cave made it seem haunted.
meanings.sent2: The backscattering of light in the prism created a beautiful rainbow.
meanings.sent3: The backscattering of whispers in the library amused the librarian.
meanings.sent4: His words had a backscattering effect, resonating with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The backscattering of music in the concert hall filled the space with harmony.
